document.docAuthor: Begum, Salma, Anis, Shoeba Binte & Khan, Mohd Talib
document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Indian species of Oligosita Walker (Hymenoptera: Trichogrammatidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Indian species of Oligosita Walker (Hymenoptera: Trichogrammatidae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Redescription. Female . Length, 0.53−0.68 mm . Body dark brown; frontovertex orange to golden yellow; eye and ocelli dark. Antenna pale brown. Mandible with tip honey brown. Mesosoma with scutellum, metanotum, propodeum in mesal third or so golden to pale yellow; mesoscutum yellow; axilla brown; tegula brown. Fore wing hyaline, veins brown, a distinct brown spot appended to stigmal vein present; disc below parastigma and below distal fourth of marginal vein to posterior margin with infuscate patches. Legs brown to dark brown, with trochanters, apices of fore and mid femora, bases and apices of tibiae and tarsal segments 1 and 2 of tarsi, pallid. Gaster with TIII to TVII (except white apex of TVII ) dark brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 23–25.
Oligosita meerutensis
Yousuf
& Shafee
, female: 23, antenna, Uttarakhand specimen; 24, fore wing, Uttarakhand specimen; 25, pronotum divided, Uttarakhand specimen.

subSubSection.paragraph: Metasoma. Gaster longer than mesosoma ( 118 : 70 ). Ovipositor about 1.3 × as long as hind tibia ( 76 : 60 ) and 1.4 × as long as mid tibia ( 76 : 54 ).

.

. Holotype , ♀ (on 2 slides), labelled, “ 103 T

10 .xi. 1983
”, and a small ticket with ‘Holotype’ written in red ink ( ZDAMU , HYM. CH . 259 ).

. Holotype , ♀ (on slide), labelled, “ 97 T
Oligosita aligarhensis
sp.n. M. Yousuf
28 .iv. 1983
”, and a ticket with ‘Holotype’ written in red ink ( ZDAMU , HYM. CH . 255 ). Paratypes , 2 ♀ (on slide), labelled, “ 151

” and a ticket with ‘Paratype’ written in green ink ( ZDAMU , HYM. CH . 255 ).

Additional material examined . INDIA : UTTARAKHAND: Dehradun, FRI , 1 ♀,
04.xi. 2009
, coll. F.R. Khan; Almora, Matikhola, 1 ♀,
28 .x. 2009
, coll. F.R. Khan. UTTAR PRADESH: Aligarh, Begum Sultan Jahan, 1 ♀,
23 .x. 2011
, coll. S. Begum; Aligarh, Dept. of Zoology, 1 ♀,
13 .x. 2010
, coll. S. Begum ( ZDAMU ). Material determined and recorded by
Hayat ( 2008 )
,
Begum & Anis ( 2013 )
and
Fatma et al. ( 2014 )
was also examined.
Distribution . India : Jharkand; Rajasthan; Uttarakhand; Uttar Pradesh.

Comments . The original description of
O. meerutensis
was based on a single female. The holotype is on two slides, one slide with one antenna and one fore wing under a large coverslip, the rest of the body (vertex and left eye broken off; antenna beyond pedicel missing) on the second slide under a small coverslip.

The original description of
O. aligarhensis
was based on
3 females
. The holotype is on a slide under a large coverslip. The two paratypes are on one slide in drops of balsam.

The original description of
O. kasimpurensis
was based on
3 females
. The holotype is on two slides, one slide with antenna and one fore wing under a large coverslip, and the rest of the body (left half of head broken off) on the second slide under a small coverslip. The two paratypes are on one slide bearing the same data as the holotype , but with collection number ‘ 433 ’.

Hayat ( 2008 )
examined the holotypes of
O. meerutensis
,
O. aligarhensis
, and
O. kasimpurensis ,
and considered the three conspecific.
